sentences.english: The environmental resources have rareness, should consider the environmental cost in economic development.
sentences.chinese: 环境资源具有稀缺性，经济发展应当考虑环境成本。

sentences.english: Generating solar power in the UK involves a spectacular waste of scarce resources.
sentences.chinese: 在英国使用太阳能发电，是对稀缺资源的巨大浪费。

sentences.english: With a lack of IMAX theaters, people are traveling long distances to see the movie.
sentences.chinese: 由于IMAX影院稀缺，人们不惜长途跋涉。

sentences.english: The farmland is a very precious resources in karst areas.
sentences.chinese: 在喀斯特区域耕地更是十分宝贵的稀缺性资源。

sentences.english: We’re predicting a real shortage in the next decade of skilled workers.
sentences.chinese: 我们预测在下一个十年，有技能的熟手比较稀缺。

sentences.english: This feeling of scarcity encourages customers to come to the stores and buy frequently.
sentences.chinese: 这种让大家觉得稀缺的感觉促使人们经常光顾和购买。

sentences.english: Robert Tollison, "Rent seeking is the expenditure of scarce resources to capture an artificially created transfer."
sentences.chinese: 寻租是耗费稀缺资源攫取的一种人为创造的财产转移。

sentences.english: The essential of public budget is collocating scarce resources.
sentences.chinese: 公共预算的实质在于配置稀缺资源。

sentences.english: Soil is the most scarce and non - regenerated resource in Karst area.
sentences.chinese: 土壤是岩溶地区不易再生的最稀缺资源。

sentences.english: Maybe there won't be enough changes in future. ThenI will stop writing," he said。
sentences.chinese: 也许未来这种变化会变得稀缺，那时我将停止写作。

sentences.english: The scarcity of particles means that the droplets that do form grow relatively large.
sentences.chinese: 微粒的稀缺意味着云滴会形成得相对更大些。

sentences.english: "Paper was a rarity back then, " Salem explains.
sentences.chinese: “书写用纸在那时是非常稀缺的，”萨勒穆解释到。

sentences.english: Top of the list of Saltillo businesses' complaints is the scarcity and cost of credit.
sentences.chinese: 萨尔蒂约商业的头条投诉就是稀缺性和信贷成本。

sentences.english: Service nowadays, I think, is playing hard-to-get.
Information is no longer a scarce resource - attention is.
sentences.chinese: 需要注意的是，信息不再是一种稀缺的资源。

sentences.english: Scarcity thinking assumes no growth and heightened competition.
sentences.chinese: 稀缺性思想假设没有成长并强调竞争。

definition: very short of (food, clean water etc)/extreme shortage/deficit
to be deficient in sth/to be short of sth (supplies, money etc)
the rarer sth is, the greater its value (idiom)
natural resource (such as water or minerals)/resource (such as manpower or tourism)
Ziyuan county in Guilin 桂林[Gui4 lin2], Guangxi

pinyin: bu4 ke3 zai4 sheng1 zi1 yuan2

definition: delicious cakes/popular person/sth that is in high demand
